text: CLOSEUP on a TELEVISION SET.  Theres a baseball game on, is turned completely down.  Camera PANS to show two cute girls, MASAMI and TOMOKO.  Masami is seated on the floor table, TEXTBOOK in front of her. Tomoko is at her desk. all over the room, and its obvious there hasnt been much on. Masami is currently in mid-story, speaking excitedly.

They say that some elementary school  kid spent the night with his parents  at a bed and breakfast in Izu.  The kid wanted to go out and play with everybody,  right, but he didnt want to miss the  program he always used to watch back in  Tokyo, so he records it on the VCR in  their room.  But of course the stations  in Izu are different from the ones in  Tokyo.  In Izu, it was just an empty  channel, so he shouldve recorded nothing but static.  But when the kid  gets back to his house and watches the  tape, all of a sudden this woman comes  on the screen and says-- Masami points so suddenly and dramatically at her friend actually jumps in her seat. MASAMI (contd)
One week from now, you will die. Short silence as Masami pauses, relishing the moment. MASAMI (contd)
Of course the kids completely  freaked, and he stops the video.   Just then the phone rings, and when he  picks it up a voice says-- Her voice drops voice almost to a whisper. MASAMI (contd)

You watched it, didnt you?  That  same time, exactly one week later...  hes dead! Masami laughs loudly, thoroughly enjoying her own perform Tomoko, however, is completely silent.  She begins lookin and more distressed, until finally Masami notices. MASAMI
What is it, Tomoko? Tomoko comes out of her chair and drops onto the floor ne friend.  Her words are quick, earnest. TOMOKO
Who did you hear that story from? MASAMI
Who?  Its just a rumor.  Everybody  knows it. TOMOKO
Youko told you?         MASAMI
No, it wasnt Youko... Tomoko looks away, worried.  Masami slaps her on the knee laughing. MASAMI
Whats up with you? Tomoko speaks slowly, still looking away. TOMOKO
The other day, I... I watched this  strange video. MASAMI
Where? TOMOKO
With Youko and them. MASAMI         (excited)
So thats what Ive been hearing  about you doing some double-date/ sleepover thing!  So, you and that  guy Iwata, huh?  TOMOKO
No, its not like that.  Nothing  happened! Their eyes meet and Tomoko half-blushes, looks away again expression becomes serious as she resumes her conversatio TOMOKO
Iwata... he found this weird video.   Everyone was like, Whats that? so  he put it on and we all watched it. MASAMI (quietly)
And?  What kind of video was it? TOMOKO

Just... weird, I cant really explain  it.  Anyway, right after we finished  watching it, the phone rang.  Whoever it was didnt say anything, but still... Silence.  Masami curls up on herself, thoroughly spooked. MASAMI
Jesus. TOMOKO It's cuz, you know, we'd all heard the
rumors. Tomoko looks seriously over at her friend. TOMOKO (cont'd)
That was one week ago today. There is a long, heavy silence as neither of them says an MASAMI
Waaait a minute.  Are you faking me  out? Tomokos face suddenly breaks into a smile.  TOMOKO
Busted, huh? They both crack up laughing.  MASAMI
Oh, my... I cant believe you!   Masami reaches out, slaps her friend on the knee. MASAMI (contd)
Youre terrible! TOMOKO
Gotcha! MASAMI         (thinking)
But hang on... you really stayed the night with Youko and Iwata,  right? Tomoko nods, uh-huh.  Masami dives forward, pinching her cheeks and grinning wildly. MASAMI
So, how far did you and he get? TOMOKO
Oh... I cant remember. MASAMI
You cant remember, huh? Masami laughs, then slaps Tomoko on the knee again as she the trick her friend played on her. MASAMI
Man, you had me freaked me out.

Just at that moment, the phone RINGS.  They are both sudd instantly serious.  Tomokos eyes go off in one direction begins shaking her head, -No-.  Masami looks over her sho following her friends gaze.   Tomoko is looking at the CLOCK, which currently reads 9:4 The phone continues to ring.  Tomoko is now clutching tig friend, looking panicked. MASAMI (softly)

Was it true? Tomoko nods her head, still holding on tightly.  Masami h forcibly disengage herself in order to stand.  The phone so Masami opens the bedroom DOOR and races down the STAIR calls out to her from behind. TOMOKO
Masami!
Tomoko and Masami run down the staircase, through the hal the kitchen.  Tomoko cries out again just before they rea TOMOKO
Masami!

Masami has come to a halt before a PHONE mounted on the w pauses, looking slowly at her friend, then back to the ph takes it tentatively from its cradle, answers it wordless tension continues to mount as nothing is said. Masami sud into a huge grin. MASAMI
Ill put her on. Still grinning, she hands the phone to Tomoko.  Tomoko sn quickly. TOMOKO (softly)
Yes? She is silent for a moment, then smiling widely.   TOMOKO
Oh, man! She is so relieved that all the strength seeps out of her sinks to the kitchen floor.  Masami, equally relieved, sl the wall and sits down next to her. TOMOKO (on the phone)
Yeah, Ive got a friend over now.   Yeah.  Yeah, OK.  Bye. Tomoko stands to place the phone back in its wall cradle, squats back down onto the kitchen floor. TOMOKO
The games gone into overtime, so  theyre gonna be a little late.  They burst out laughing with relief again, and are soon b clutching their stomachs. TOMOKO
Jeeezus, my parents... MASAMI
Oh man, Im tellin everybody about  this tomorrow! Tomoko shakes her head, -Dont you dare-. MASAMI
Im gonna use your bathroom.  Dont  go anywhere. TOMOKO

Masami walks out of the kitchen. Alone now, Tomoko stands toward the SINK, where she takes a GLASS from the DISH RA then goes to the FRIDGE and sticks her face in, looking f to drink.  Suddenly there is the SOUND of people clapping cheering.  Tomoko, startled, peers her head over the refr door to check for the source of the sound.   She begins walking slowly, following the sound to the DIN adjacent the kitchen.

The lights are off, and there is no one in the room.  Tom moment, bathed in the garish LIGHT from the TV, which has on.  Playing is the same baseball game they had on the TV same game that Tomokos parents are currently at.  The VOL quite high. A puzzled look on her face, Tomoko takes the REMOTE from table and flicks the TV off.  She walks back to the kitch

A bottle of SODA that Tomoko had earlier taken from the f the kitchen table.  She picks the bottle up, pours hersel Before she can take a sip, however, the air around her be charged, heavy.  Her body begins to shiver as somewhere o comes a popping, crackling SOUND underscored by a kind of Trembling now, Tomoko spins around to see what she has al lurking behind her.  She draws in her breath to scream. The screen goes white, and fades into:
The screen is filled with the visage of a nervous-looking She is being interviewed by ASAKAWA, a female reporter se ASAKAWA (O.S.)
There seems to be a popular rumor  going around about a cursed  videotape. YOUNG GIRL
Uh-huh. ASAKAWA (O.S.)
Have you heard what kind of video  it might be? YOUNG GIRL
Uh-huh. The girl looks directly at the camera, her mouth dropping as shes suddenly overcome by a kind of stage fright.  She staring, silently, at the camera.

KOMIYA, the cameraman, has lowered his camera. We can now the young girl being interviewed is seated at a table bet friends, a SHORT-HAIRED GIRL (GIRL#2) and a LONG-HAIRED G They are all dressed in the UNIFORMS of junior high schoo Opposite them sits Komiya and Asakawa, a pretty woman in twenties.  A BOOM MIKE GUY stands to the left. KOMIYA
Uh, dont look right at the camera,
YOUNG GIRL
Sorry. ASAKAWA
Lets do it again. Asakawa glances over her shoulder, makes sure that Komiya ASAKAWA
Have you heard what kind of video  it might be? YOUNG GIRL
What I heard was, all of a sudden  this scaaarry lady comes on the screen and says, In one week, you will die. GIRL #2
I heard that if youre watching TV  late at night itll come on, and then your phonell ring. ASAKAWA
Watching TV late at night... do you know what station? GIRL #2
Mmmm... I heard some local station,  around Izu. ASAKAWA
Izu? GIRL #2
Mmm-hmm.         ASAKAWA
And, do you know if anyones really  died from watching it? The girl flashes a look at her two friends. YOUNG GIRL
Well, no one that we know, right? Girl #2 nods her head. Girl #3 nods slowly, opens and clo mouth as if deciding whether to say something or not.  Th reporter notices.  ASAKAWA
What is it? GIRL #3
I heard this from a friend of mine  in high school.  She said that there  was this one girl who watched the  video, and then died a week later.   She was out on a drive with her  boyfriend. ASAKAWA
They were in a wreck? GIRL #3
No, their car was parked, but they  were both dead inside.  Her  boyfriend died because hed watched  the video, too.  Thats what my  friend said. Girl #3 grows suddenly defensive. GIRL #3 (contd)
Its true!  It was in the paper two  or three days ago. ASAKAWA
Do you know the name of the high  school this girl went to? GIRL #3
No... I heard this from my friend,  and it didnt happen at her school.   She heard it from a friend at a  different school, she said.
Asakawa is seated at her DESK.  The station is filled wit scrabbling to meet deadlines.  Komiya walks up to Asakawa and holds out a MANILA FOLDER. KOMIYA
Mrs. Asakawa? ASAKAWA
Hm? KOMIYA
Here you are. ASAKAWA (taking the folder)
Thanks. Komiya has a seat. KOMIYA

This same kind of thing happened  about ten years ago too, didnt it?   Some popular young singer committed  suicide, and then suddenly there was  all this talk about her ghost showing up on some music show. ASAKAWA
But I wonder what this rumors all  about. Everyone you ask always  mentions Izu. KOMIYA

Maybe thats where it all started.   Hey, where was that Kuchi-sake Onna * story from again? >* Literally Ripped-Mouth Lady, a kind of ghastly spectre >Japanese folk stories who wears a veil to hide her mouth >has been ripped or cut open from ear to ear. She wanders >countryside at night asking men Do you think Im beautifu >lowering her veil to reveal her true features. ASAKAWA
Gifu, but there was some big  accident out there, and that ended up being what started the rumor.  KOMIYA
A big accident? ASAKAWA

Mmm-hmm.  Something terrible like  that is going to stay in peoples  minds.  Sometimes the story of what  happened gets twisted around, and  ends up coming back as a rumor like  this one. Thats what they say, at  least. KOMIYA
Dyou think something like that  happened out at Izu? ASAKAWA
Maybe. Well, anyway, Im off.  See you tomorrow. KOMIYA
See you. Asakawa gets up from her desk and begins walking towards She takes only a few steps before noticing a RACK of rece
She takes one from the rack, sets it on a nearby TABLE. flipping the pages, and suddenly spies this story:

head_text.subj: STRANGE AUTOMOBILE DEATH OF YOUNG COUPLE IN YOKOHAMA

text: The bodies of a young man and woman were discovered in th passenger car at around 10 A.M. September 6th.  The locat vacant lot parallel to Yokohama Prefectural Road.  Local identified the deceased as a 19-year old preparatory scho of Tokyo, and a 16-year old Yokohama resident, a student private all-girls high school. Because there were no exte injuries, police are investigating the possibility of dru suicide... Just then two men walk by, a GUY IN A BUSINESS SUIT and a intern named OKAZAKI.  Okazaki is carrying an armload of GUY IN SUIT
OK, Okazaki, Im counting on you. OKAZAKI
Yessir. The guy in the suit pats Okazaki on the shoulder and walk Okazaki turns to walk away, spots Asakawa bent over the s and peering intently at the newspaper article. OKAZAKI
Miss Asakawa?  I thought you were  going home early today. Asakawa turns around and begins speaking excitedly. ASAKAWA
Okazaki, can I ask you a favor? OKAZAKI
Sure. Asakawa points to the newspaper. ASAKAWA
Could you check out this article  for me?  Get me some more info.?         OKAZAKI
I guess... ASAKAWA
Good.  Call me as soon as you know  more, OK? OKAZAKI
Maam. Asakawa walks off.  Okazaki, still carrying the videotape forward to take a look at the article.
Asakawa drives her car into the lot and parks quickly.  S out, runs up the STAIRCASE to the third floor.  She stops of a door, sticks her KEY in the lock, and opens it.
A BOY of about 7 is sitting in an ARMCHAIR facing the ver can see only the back of his head. ASAKAWA (O.S.)

Yoichi! Hearing his name, the boy puts down the BOOK he was readi stands up, facing the door.  He is wearing a white DRESS a brown sweater-type VEST over it.  He sees Asakawa, his run in the door.  She is panting lightly. ASAKAWA
Sorry Im late.  Oh, youve already  changed. YOICHI
Yup.  He points over to his mothers right. YOICHI (contd)
I got your clothes out for you. Asakawa turns to see a DARK SUIT hanging from one of the room shelves.  She reaches out, takes it. ASAKAWA
Aargh, weve gotta hurry! She runs into the next room to change.
Asakawa has changed into all-black FUNERAL ATTIRE.  Her h up, and she is fastening the clasp to a pearl NECKLACE. still in the living room. ASAKAWA
Did grandpa call? YOICHI (O.S.)
Nope. Yoichi walks into the room and faces his mother. YOICHI
Why did Tomo-chan die? * >* -chan is a suffix in Japanese that denotes closeness o >It is most often used for young girls, though it can als >boys. ASAKAWA
Well... it looks like she was really,  really sick. She takes a seat on the bed. ASAKAWA
Will you do me up? Yoichi fastens the rear button of his mothers dress and z YOICHI
You can die even if youre young? ASAKAWA
If its something serious... well, yes. Asakawa turns to face her son, puts an arm around him. ASAKAWA
As hard as it is for us, what your  auntie and uncle are going through  right now is even harder, so lets  not talk about this over there, OK? Yoichi nods. ASAKAWA (remembering)
You and her used to play a lot  together, didnt you? Yoichi says nothing.
RED PAPER LANTERNS mark this place as the site of a wake. GIRLS in high school uniforms are standing together and t groups. Asakawa and Yoichi, walking hand in hand, enter t
There are many PEOPLE milling about, speaking softly.  A at a counter is taking monetary donations from guests and their information into a LEDGER.  Asakawa and Yoichi cont down a hallway.

Mother and son halt before the open DOOR to the main wake guests may show their respects to the departed.  The room traditional Japanese-style tatami, a kind of woven straw serves as a carpet. Two GUESTS, their shoes off, are knee zabuton cushions.   Kneeling opposite the guests is KOUICHI, Asakawas father. guests are bowing deeply, and Kouichi bows in response. ASAKAWA
Dad. Kouichi turns to see her. KOUICHI
Ah! ASAKAWA
How is sis holding up? KOUICHI
Shes resting inside right now.   Shes shaken up pretty badly, you  know.  Its best she just take  things easy for a while. Asakawa nods. ASAKAWA
Ill go check on auntie and them,  then. KOUICHI

OK.  Ah, Yoichi.  Why dont you sit  here for a little while? He grabs the young boy and seats him on a cushion next to As the guests resume their conversation with Asakawas fat eyes wander to the ALTAR at the front of the room set up deceased.  It is made of wood, and surrounded by candles, small paper lanterns.  At the center is a PICTURE of the teenage girl.  A small wooden PLAQUE reads her name: Tomo is the same Tomoko from the first scene. Yoichi continues to stare at Tomokos picture.  He makes a gesture as he does so, rubbing his index finger in small between his eyes.

Asakawa walks down the hallway, looking for her aunt.  Sh finding the open doorway to the kitchen.  There are a few there, preparing busily. Asakawa sees her AUNT, who rushe hallway to meet her, holds her fast by the arm.  The aunt fierce, quick whisper. AUNT
Have you heard anything more about  Tomo-chans death? ASAKAWA
No, I... AUNT
But the police have already finished  their autopsy! ASAKAWA
Well, they said there was no sign of  foul play. AUNT         (shaking her head)
That was no normal death.  They havent  once opened the casket to let us see the body.  Dont you think thats  strange? Asakawa looks away, thinking.

Yoichi has wandered off by himself.  He stops at the foot steps, looking up-- and catches a glimpse of a pair of BA running up to the second floor.   A guarded expression on his face, Yoichi walks slowly up stairs.

Yoichi has wandered into Tomokos bedroom.  The lights are and there is an eerie feel to it.  Yoichis eyes wander ab room, finally coming to rest on the TELEVISION SET.  Sudd hears his mothers voice from behind him. ASAKWAWA (O.S.)
Yoichi? Yoichi turns to face her as she approaches, puts an arm a ASAKAWA

What are you doing up here?  You shouldnt just walk into other  peoples rooms. Without replying, Yoichis gaze slowly returns to the tele set.  Asakawa holds him by the shoulders, turning him to her. ASAKAWA
You go on downstairs, OK? YOICHI
He turns to leave, and Asakawa follows.
Just as Yoichi and Asakawa are about to descend the steps Asakawas CELL PHONE rings.  She opens the clasp to her PU ASAKAWA         (to Yoichi)
You go on ahead. YOICHI
He walks down the steps.  Asakawa brings out her cell pho answers it. ASAKAWA
Hello? OKAZAKI

Uh... this is Okazaki.  Ive got  some more info on that article for you.  The girl was a student of  the uh, Seikei School for Women in  Yokahama City. Asakawa blinks at this, looks disturbed. ASAKAWA         (softly)
Thanks. She hangs up the phone.

Asakawa stands now at the entrance of the house.  Dazedly walks toward a large, hand-painted PLACARD.  The placard that the wake is being held for a student of the Seikei S for Women.  Asakawa stares at that placard, making the mental connect She turns abruptly, walks towards a nearby TRIO of HIGH S GIRLS. ASAKAWA
Excuse me.  This is, um, kind of a strange question, but by any chance  were you friends of that young girl that died in the car as well? The three girls turn their faces to the ground. ASAKAWA
Please.  If you know anything... GIRL RIGHT
They all died the same day.  Youko.   Tomoko.  Even Iwata, he was in a motorcycle accident. GIRL LEFT
Because they watched the video. ASAKAWA
Video? GIRL LEFT
Thats what Youko said.  They all watched some weird video, and  after that their phone rang. ASAKAWA
Tomoko-chan watched it, too?   Where? Girl Left shakes her head. GIRL LEFT
She just said they all stayed  somewhere. GIRL RIGHT
There was a girl with Tomoko when  she died.  Shes had to be  hospitalized for shock. GIRL MIDDLE
They say she wont go anywhere  near a television.

Asakawa and YOSHINO, another news reporter, are watching from the Yokohama car death.  In the footage there are lo POLICEMEN milling about, one of them trying to pick the d the passenger side.  Yoshino is giving Asakawa the blow-b YOSHINO

The bodies of those found were  Tsuji Youko, age 17, a student of  the Seikei School for Women, and  Nomi Takehiko, age 19, preparatory  school student.  Both their doors  were securely locked. Onscreen, the policeman has finally picked the lock.  The and a girls BODY halffalls out, head facing upwards.  Yos a BUTTON on the control panel, scans the footage frame by stops when he gets a good close-up of the victim.  Her face is twisted into an insane rictus of fear, mouth wide and glassy. Yoshino and Asakawa lean back in their s YOSHINO
This is the first time Ive -ever-  seen something like this. ASAKAWA
Cause of death? YOSHINO
Couldnt say, aside from sudden  heart failure. ASAKAWA
Drugs? YOSHINO

The autopsy came up negative. Yoshino takes the video off pause.  Onscreen, a policeman the young girls body from completely falling out, and is back into the car.  As the body moves into an upright pos can see that the girls PANTIES are mid-way around her lef YOSHINO
These two, about to go at it,  suddenly up and die for no  apparent reason.  He sighs. YOSHINO (contd)
Do -you- get it?
Asakawas CAR is already halted before a modest-sized, two with a small covered parkway for a garage.  She gets out closes the door.  She stares at the house, unmoving.

Asakawa stands before her SISTER RYOMI, who is seated at TABLE.  Ryomi is staring blankly away, making no sign of her sister.  The silence continues unabated, and Asakawa, wanders idly into the adjoining dining room.  She takes a the television, the same television that had puzzled Tomo switching itself on, sitting darkly in one corner.  Her r the screen looks stretched, distorted. RYOMI        (O.S.)
They tell me that Yoichi came to  the funeral, too.  Asakawa steps back into the kitchen.  She addresses her s continues to stare out at nothing. ASAKAWA
Mmm-hmm. RYOMI
They used to play a lot together, didnt they?  Upstairs. ASAKAWA
Yeah... Ryomi lapses back into a silence.  Asakawa waits for her but when it is clear that nothing else is forthcoming, sh up and exits the kitchen.
Asakawa climbs the steps to the second floor.  She makes the hall.

As if intruding, Asakawa walks slowly, cautiously into To The window to the room is open, and a single piece of fol on Tomokos desk flutters in the breeze.  Asakawa walks to it up.  It is a RECEIPT from a photo shop.  The developed to be claimed.   Asakawa senses something, spins to look over her shoulder has crept quietly up the stairs and down the hall, and st doorway to Tomokos room.  She appears not to notice what her hands, as her gaze has already shifted to the sliding She regards it almost druggedly. RYOMI (haltingly)
This... this is where Tomoko died.
RYOMI (O.S.)

Tomoko! Ryomis hands fling aside the CLOSET DOOR.  Within, she fi blue CARCASS of her daughter, curled up into an unnatural Tomokos mouth yawns gaping, her eyes glassy and rolled up of her head.  Her hands are caught in her hair, as if try out by the roots.  It is a horrific scene, one that says if from some unspeakable fear.
Ryomi sinks to her knees, hitting the wooden floor hard. face into her hands and begins sobbing loudly.  Asakawa s

Asakawa leaves the camera shop clutching Tomokos unclaime walks out onto the sidewalk and begins flipping through t Tomoko standing arm-in-arm with Iwata, her secret boyfrie her friends eating lunch.  The camera had its date-and-ti enabled, and the photos are marked 97 8 29. The next shot is of Tomoko, Iwata, and another young coup front of a SIGN for a bed and breakfast.  The sign reads:
ASAKAWA

Izu... Asakawa continues looking through the photos, various sho four friends clowning around in their room.  Suddenly she shot taken the next day, at check out.  The friends are l linked-- and all four of their faces are blurred, distort someone had taken an eraser to them and tried to rub them existence.
Asakawa wears an APRON, and is frying something up on the stands watching. ASAKAWA
Look, Im probably going to be late coming home tonight, so just stick  your dinner in the microwave when  youre ready to eat, OK? YOICHI
K... Mom? ASAKAWA
Hmm? YOICHI
Tomo-chan watched some cursed video! Asakawa leaves the food on the stove, runs over to Yoichi by the shoulders.  She shakes him roughly. ASAKAWA
What did you say?  You are not to  speak of this at school, do you  hear me? YOICHI         (utterly unfazed)
I wont.  Im going to school now. Yoichi walks off.  Asakawa goes back to the stove, but st a few stirs, staring off and thinking. Caption-- September 13th.  Monday.
Asakawa drives her car speedily along a narrow country ro blowing up in her wake.
Asakawa mutters to herself, deep in thought. ASAKAWA
Theres no way...
Asakawas car drives past a sign reading:
Asakawa has left her car and is walking around the drivew less a bed and breakfast and more like a series of cabin-

She wanders about for a while, trying to get her bearings now in front of a particular cottage and reaches into her withdraws the PICTURE from the photomat, the one that sho her friends with their faces all blurred.  The four are p of their cottage, marked in the photograph as B4.  Asakaw photo to regard the cottage before her.
She walks to the door, turns the handle experimentally. Asakawa walks in.

Asakawa lets her eyes wander around the cottage.  It look all wood paneling and spacious comfort.   Her eyes rest on the TV/VCR setup at the front of the roo before the VCR now, she presses the eject button.  Nothin She fingers the inside of the deck, finds it empty, then to the rear of the VCR, searching.  Again, there is nothi presses the power button on the television, picks up the takes a seat on the SOFA.  She runs through a few channel all talk shows, no clues whatsoever.  She flicks the TV o back in the sofa, sighing. Just then, she spies a LEDGER on the coffee table.  These sometimes left in hotels in Japan, so that guests can wri comments about their stay for others to read.  Asakawa pi ledger up, begins thumbing through it.  She stops at a st obviously drawn by a child, that shows three rotund, almo round personages.  She reads the handwritten MESSAGE. ASAKAWA

"My dad is fat.  My mom is fat.   Thats why Im fat, too." She smiles in spite of herself.   Asakawa flips through the rest of the ledger, but theres of any import.   She tosses it back onto the coffee table and, sighing aga the sofa and closes her eyes.
Asakawa eats silently, alone.
Asakawa has returned to the bed and breakfast.  As she wa door, the COUNTER CLERK rises out of his chair to greet h CLERK
Room for one? ASAKAWA
Um, actually Im here on business. She passes the clerk a picture of Tomoko and her three ot He stares at it for a moment. ASAKAWA
They would have stayed here on  August 29th, all four of them.   If theres any information you  might have... CLERK
Uh, hang on just a minute.   The clerk turns his back to her, begins leafing through a CLERK         (to himself)

August 29th... While she waits, Asakawas eyes start to wander around the Behind the desk is a sign reading Rental Video, and a lar BOOKSHELF filled with VIDEOTAPES. They are all in their o and she lets her eyes glance over the titles.  Raiders of 48 Hours-- --and then, suddenly, she spies a VIDEOTAPE in a plain, u sleeve, tucked away in the back of the very bottom shelf. the hairs on the back of her neck rise. ASAKAWA
That... The clerk looks up. CLERK
Hmm? Asakawa stabs a finger excitedly towards the shelf. ASAKAWA
That!  What tape is that? The clerk reaches out for it, grabs it. CLERK
This?  Hmm... The clerk pulls the tape out of its SLEEVE and checks for Its unmarked. CLERK
Maybe one of the guests left it behind...

Asakawa flips on the TV.  Its on channel 2, and there is static. She kneels down to slide the tape into the deck a moment, framed in the vaguely spectral LIGHT from the tel screen.  Steeling her nerves, she puts the tape into the up the remote, and presses play. NOTE: This next scene is entirely visual.  If you are rea translation before watching the movie, do yourself a favo reading this now and watch the scene for itself.  Afterwa come back here to check the meaning of the Japanese chara displayed.

At first it looks like nothing has happened-- then Asakaw she is now viewing recorded static instead of broadcast s watches, waiting, but the static continues unbroken.  Asa down at the remote, is about to press fast forward, when picture on the screen clears and for a moment she thinks at the moon. Its not the moon at all, she realizes.  The shape is roun moon, but it seems to be made up of thin RIBBONS of cloud against a night sky.  And theres a FACE, she sees, a face shadows, looking down from above.   What is this? The scene changes now, and Asakawa notes that the tape ha grainy quality one sees in 3rd or 4th generation copies. a WOMAN brushing her long hair before an oval-shaped MIRR wracking grating as if of some giant metallic insect soun background, but the lady doesnt seem to notice.  The mirr using to brush her hair suddenly changes position from th the wall before which she stands, to the right.  Almost i mirror returns to its original position, but in that one changed location we see a small FIGURE in a white GOWN. towards where that figure stood, and smiles. The screen next becomes a twitching, undulating impenetra kanji characters used in the Japanese language.  Asakawa only two things recognizable: local     volcanic eruption Now the screen is awash in PEOPLE-- crawling, scrabbling, masses, some of them moving in reverse.  A sound like moa them.
A FIGURE stands upon a shore, its face shrouded.  It poin not towards the screen, but at something unseen off to on insect-like screeching sounds louder.
Close up on inhuman, alien-looking EYE.  Inside that eye character is reflected in reverse:  SADA, meaning "chasti The eye blinks once, twice.  The symbol remains.
A long shot of an outdoor, uncovered WELL.

Sudden loud, blinding STATIC as the tape ends. Asakawa turns the TV off, looking physically drained.  Sh and slumps forward, resting on her knees.  Just then, she television screen.  She sees, reflected, a small FIGURE i standing at the rear of the room.  Shocked, Asakawa draws spins around. The room is empty.  Asakawa runs to the sofa to collect h --and the RINGING of the telephone stops her dead in her like, she walks towards the telephone, picks it up wordle From the other end comes the same metallic, insectoid SQU the video.  Asakawa slams the phone down and glances up a Its about seven minutes after 7 P.M. ASAKAWA         (to herself)
One week... Asakawa grabs her coat, pops the tape out of the deck, an door.

It is dark and raining heavily.  Yoichi, Asakawas son, is school, UMBRELLA firmly in hand.  The sidewalk is quite n comes to a halt when a second PERSON comes from the oppos blocking his way. Yoichi slowly raises his umbrella, peer this other pedestrian.  It is a MAN, a BAG slung over one has a beard; unusual for Japan where clean-shaven is the The two continue looking directly at each other, neither speaking.  Yoichi then walks around the persons left and way.  The man resumes walking as well. Caption-- September 14th.  Tuesday.
The bearded man, whose name is RYUJI, reaches out to pres but the door has already opened from within.  Asakawa lea the door open for him.  Neither of them speaks.  Wordless the apartment.

Ryuji puts his bag down, looks around the apartment.  The ominous somehow.  He takes his JACKET off and wanders int Asakawa is in the kitchen behind him, preparing TEA.  Ryu collection of FRAMED PHOTOGRAPHS in living room. RYUJI
Yoichis in elementary school  already, is he? ASAKAWA
His first year.  What about you,  Ryuji?  How have you been  recently? RYUJI
Same as always. She takes a seat next to him, serves the tea.  On the cof before them is a VIDEOTAPE in a plain, unmarked case. ASAKAWA
And money is...? RYUJI
Im teaching at university. Ryuji picks up his cup of tea but stops, grimacing, befor lips.  He rubs his forehead as if experiencing a sudden h shakes it off and quickly regains his composure. RYUJI
Anyway.  You said that the phone rang? ASAKAWA
Thats right. RYUJI
So if I watch it too, that phone over  there-- He gestures with his mug  RYUJI (contd)
--should ring. ASAKAWA
Ryuji, four people have already  died.  On the same day! RYUJI (flippant)

Well, why dont you try calling  an exorcist? He takes a sip of his tea.  Asakawa reaches quickly, grab from the bookshelf behind her-- a POLAROID CAMERA.    She into Ryujis hands, then turns to look down at the floor. ASAKAWA
Take my picture. Ryuji raises the camera to his eye. RYUJI
Turn this way. ASAKAWA         (unmoving)

Hurry up and take it. Ryuji snaps off a shot.  It comes out the other end and h waits impatiently for an image to appear.  When it does, do is pass it wordlessly over to Asakawa.  Her face is tw misshapen.   Just like the picture of Tomoko and her friends. Asakawa stares at it, horrified.  By the time she finally Ryuji has already risen from his seat and slid the videot VCR.  Again, the screen is filled with static, only to be with what looks like the moon.  Asakawa slams the Polaroi coffee table and goes outside onto the veranda.
Asakawa stares out at a view of the houses shaded in clou There is a knock on the glass door behind her.  A moment Ryuji slides the door open. RYUJI
Its over. Asakawa re-enters her apartment.
RYUJI
Well, it looks like your phones not  ringing. Ryuji pops the tape from the deck, hands it to Asakawa. RYUJI
Make me a copy of this, will you?   Id like to do a little research of my own. Theres no reason to  write us off as dead just yet.  He dramatically takes a seat. RYUJI        (contd)
If theres a video, that means that  somebody had to make it. ASAKAWA

Theres the guest list from the  cottage to look into... and the  possibility of someone hacking  into the local stations broadcast  signals. Asakawa pulls a NOTEPAD from her purse and begins busily away.
Okazaki putters around. Caption- September 15th.  Tuesday.

Asakawa sits by herself, reviewing the videotape.  She is the very last scene, an outdoor shot of a well.  She star carefully, and notices... The tape ends, filling the screen with static.  A split-s afterwards, there is a KNOCK on the door and Okazaki ente a FILE.  Asakawa momentarily forgets about the video. OKAZAKI         (handing her the file)
Heres that guest list you wanted. ASAKAWA
Oh, thanks. OKAZAKI
What are you gonna do with this? ASAKAWA
Uh... sorry, Im working on  something personal.

location: IN FRONT OF A TRAIN STATION

text: Some quick shots of a FOUNTAIN gushing water, PIGEONS fla looking agitated.  CUT to Ryuji sitting on a BENCH.  Hes thought, writing in a NOTEPAD. There are multitudes of PE him, and we can hear the sounds of their coming and going OF LEGS attached to a woman in white dress, hose, and pum heading directly for Ryuji.  Her pace is slow, rhythmical that pace progresses all other sounds FADE into the backg that all we can hear is the CLOMP, CLOMP as those legs wa just before Ryuji.  The pumps are scuffed, dirtied with g A gust of WIND rips by.  Ryuji fights the urge to look up ears rings the same hollowed, multi-voiced BABBLING heard videotape.  The sound grows stronger. RYUJI (VO)
So, it was you.  You did it. The babbling fades, disappears as slowly the worlds norma background sounds return.  Ryuji looks up, but the woman is nowhere to be seen.
Ryuji rides up on a BICYCLE. He turns the corner towards apartment and finds Asakawa seated on the steps, waiting RYUJI
Hey. Asakawa notes in his face that something is wrong. ASAKAWA
What happened to you? RYUJI (gruffly)
Nothing. He enters the building, carrying his bicycle.  Asakawa fo
The two walk down the hallway towards the FRONT DOOR to R apartment.  He unlocks the door and they enter.
Ryuji and Asakawa enter the living room. RYUJI
So, whatd you come up with? ASAKAWA

I dont think any of the guests on  the list brought the tape with them.   I couldnt confirm it face-to-face  of course, but even over the phone I  got the feeling they were all being  upfront with me. RYUJI
How about the other angle?  Pirate  signals or... Asakawa shakes her head. ASAKAWA
Therere no traces of any illegal  television signals being broadcast  around Izu.  She reaches into her purse, pulls out a large white ENVEL ASAKAWA

Heres that copy of the videotape  you wanted. Ryuji tears the package open.  He squats down on the tata frontof his TV and slides the tape in.  Asakawa sits on t tatami as well, but positions herself away from the TV an her eyes averted.  Ryuji glares over his shoulder at her. RYUJI (sternly)

Asakawa. She reluctantly scoots closer, looks up at the screen.  R fast-forwards the tape a bit, stopping at the scene where woman is brushing her long hair before an oval mirror.  H the video on frame-by-frame.  RYUJI
Have you ever seen this woman? Asakawa regards the screen intently. ASAKAWA

No... The tape advances to the scene where the mirror suddenly positions.  When it does, we can again see the small figu white gown, a figure with long black hair. When Ryuji see his body stiffens, becomes tense.  Asakawa notices but sa She also notices something else. ASAKAWA (excitedly)
Theres something strange about  this shot. She takes the remote from Ryuji, rewinds it a ways.  Onsc woman begins coming her long hair again. ASAKAWA
From this angle, the mirror should  be reflecting whoevers filming. RYUJI
So, what does that mean? Asakawa lets out a short sigh. ASAKAWA
Well, if the person who made this  is a pro, thered be a way around  that, I guess, but still... The screen changes, showing the mass of squiggling kanji again. RYUJI                 (reading)
Volcanic eruption... Eruption where? He pauses the screen, trying to make sense of what is wri ASAKAWA

This is gonna be impossible to figure  out on just a regular TV screen,  dont you think? They are both still staring at the screen when from behin the SOUND of someone opening the front door.  Ryuji turns ejects the tape from the deck. RYUJI

Come on in. Asakawa flashes a look at Ryuji and then turns her head b the front door to see who has entered.  A cute, nervous-l GIRL with short hair approaches slowly.  She is carrying filled with groceries. RYUJI
Asakawa, meet my student, Takano Mai. He turns, addresses Mai. RYUJI        (contd)
This is Asakawa, my ex-wife. Ryuji gets up and walks conveniently away. MAI
Nice to meet you.  Im Takano. ASAKAWA

Asakawa. * > * As you may already be aware, Japanese name order is t >opposite of Englishs, and even close friends may continu >address one another by their last names.  Incidentally, >first name is Reiko.  In this scene, Mai deferentially r >to Ryuji as sensei, meaning teacher. Mai sets the bag of groceries down and chases after Ryuji putting on his jacket and getting ready to leave. MAI
Sensei, the people from the  publishing company called about  the deadline on your thesis again.  RYUJI                 (brusquely)
Whatre they talkin to you  about it for? MAI
Because they can never get a  hold of you. Ryuji picks up his keys, video firmly in hand. RYUJI
Ask them to wait another week. MAI
Sensei, ask them yourself,  please. Ryuji is already headed for the door.  His back is to her responds. RYUJI

Asakawa walks after him.  They leave. Mai pouts unhappily a bit, and then breaks into a smile a crosses her mind.  She walks across the room to where Ryu up a large BLACKBOARD filled with mathematical equations. Mai rubs out part of one equation with her sleeve and wri new value.
Asakawa and Ryuji stride purposefully.  They stop before the right, which Asakawa unlocks.  They both walk in.

Asakawa and Ryuji sit in a completely darkened room, thei glued to the television MONITOR.  They are again watching with the fragmented kanji characters, but despite their e been able to identify only one additional word, bringing to three: volcanic eruption          local             residents RYUJI
This is impossible. Ryuji fast forwards, stopping at the scene with the kanji inside an alien-looking EYE.  He reads the kanji aloud.  RYUJI
Sada...  Ryuji moves to make a note of this, notices the time. RYUJI
Is Yoichi gonna be all right? ASAKAWA         (sadly)
Hes used to it... Short silence.  Ryuji breaks it by gesturing towards the RYUJI

Whoever made this had to have left  some kind of clue behind.  Theyre  probably waiting for us to find it. Asakawa turns a DIAL to bring up the volume, which up unt been  on mute.  The room is filled with an eerie, metalli and Asakawa spins the dial again, shutting it off.  Just Ryujis eyes widen. RYUJI

Wait a minute. He turns the dial again, punches a few buttons as if sear something.  He listens carefully, and when he hears that something again he stops, looks at the screen. It is paused at the scene with the figure, pointing, a CL over its head.  The figure now looks oddly like a messeng Ryuji and Asakawa exchange glances.  This could be it.  R some more switches, setting the sound for super-slow mo. is a strange, labored sort of speech- a hidden message-- the skittering distortion of the tape in slow motion.  TAPE
Shoooomonnn bakkkkkarrri toou...   boooouuuukonn ga kuuru zouuu... RYUJI         (repeating)
Shoumon bakkari, boukon ga kuru  zo.  Did you hear that, too? Asakawa nods.  Ryuji is already writing it down excitedly ASAKAWA
What does that mean? Ryuji tears the sheet of paper off the notepad, folds it, it into his shirt pocket. RYUJI
Im gonna check it out.
Yoichi is walking to school.  He looks back over his shou once,then resumes walking.

All the lights are turned off, and she is sitting on the couch watching the footage of her cafe interview with the school girls.   Caption-- September 16th.  Thursday. Just when the girl in the interview mentions that whomeve the video is supposed to afterwards receive a phone call, own phone RINGS, startling her. She runs to answer it. ASAKAWA
Hello? RYUJI (O.S.)

Ive got it.  Its a dialect, just  like I thought.  SHOUMON means  playing in the water and BOUKON means monster. * >* Translated from standard Japanese, the phrase from the >would initially have sounded like, "If only SHOUMON then >BOUKON will come."  These two capitalized words, later i >be dialectical, were at the time completely incomprehens >and Asakawa.  Dialect can vary dramatically from region >Japan, to the point of speakers of different dialect bei >understand one another.   >The phrase on the tape can now be rendered, "If you keep >the water, the monster will come for you." ASAKAWA
But, dialect from where? RYUJI
Oshima.  And the site of our  eruption is Mt. Mihara.

Ryuji and Asakawa are seated at cubicles, looking through ARCHIVES of old newspaper articles.  Asakawa sneaks a loo stands up and walks off a little ways.  She has already p cell phone. ASAKAWA         (whispering, on phone)
Yoichi?  Im gonna be a little  late tonight, honey.  Ryuji looks over his shoulder at her, scowls. ASAKAWA

You can do it yourself, right?  OK.   Sorry.  Bye. She hangs up, returns to her seat at the cubicle.  She re scanning of the newspaper articles, and Ryuji shoots her Asakawa turns a page and then stops, frowning.  She has s that looks like... Nervously, Asakawa puts the thumb and forefinger of each forming the shape of a rectangle.  Or a screen.  She plac over the article she has just discovered, its headlines r Mount Mihara Erupts         Local Residents Urged to Take Ryuji notices her, leans forward excitedly. ASAKAWA

Ive got it!  This old article... The two scan the remainder of the page, and find a smalle article.         Did Local Girl Predict Eruption? A young lady from Sashikiji prefecture... The two read over both articles, absorbing the details. suddenly, gathering his things. ASAKAWA
What are you doing? RYUJI
Has your newspaper got someone out  there at Oshima? ASAKAWA
I think so.  There should be a  correspondent out there. RYUJI
I need you to find out, and let me  know how to get hold of him. Tonight. He begins walking briskly away.  Asakawa chases after him ASAKAWA
What do you think youre--? RYUJI         (angrily)
Youve only got four days left,  Asakawa!  Your newspaper contact  and I can handle this from here  on out.  You just stay with Yoichi. Ryuji strides off.  Asakawa stands motionless.

A car speeds along.  CUT to a gravel DRIVEWAY leading up traditional-style HOUSE.  Kouichi, Asakawas father, is st the entrance and puttering around in his GARDEN.  The car previous shot drives up, comes to a halt.  The passenger Yoichi hops out, running towards the old man.  Asakawa wa after her son. YOICHI
Grandpa! KOUICHI
Whoa, there!  So, you made it, huh? Caption-- September 17th.  Friday. ASAKAWA
Yoichi says hes looking forward to  doing some fishing with you. KOUICHI
Is that so? Yoichi begins tugging excitedly at his grandfathers arm. YOICHI
Cmon grandpa, lets go! KOUICHI
OK, OK.  Well get our things  together and then we can go.
Asakawa stands on a RIVERBANK while her father and Yoichi are ankle-deep in a shallow river.  Yoichi holds a small Asakawas dad is pointing and chattering excitedly.  KOUICHI
There he is!  Cmon, there he is,  dont let him go! Yoichi tries to scoop up the fish his grandfather is poin KOUICHI
Oh, oh!  Ah... guess he got away,  huh? YOICHI
That was your fault, grandpa. Asakawas father laughs. KOUICHI
Well, whaddya say we try again? He begins sloshing noisily out to the center of the strea tow. KOUICHI
Well get im this time. Asakawa looks away, pensive.

Yoichi is passed out asleep on the tatami mats.  A TELEVI inone corner of the living room, but it is switched off. SLIDING DOORS to the adjacent guest room are open and we futons set out, ready for bed. Asakawa enters the living room and, seeing Yoichi, scoops her arms and carries him over to the guest room. YOICHI (sleepily)
How was work, mommy? Asakawa tucks him into the futons and walks silently off.
Asakawa stands at the foot of the staircase, telephone RE hand.  The phone rests on a small STAND by the staircase. ASAKAWA
Hello? RYUJI (O.S.)
Yeah.  Your Oshima contact came  through.  It looks like the woman  who predicted the Mihara eruption  is the same woman from the video.
Ryuji is crouched in front of the TV, REMOTE in hand.  Th paused on the scene of the woman brushing her long hair. RYUJI
Her name is Yamamura Shizuko.  She  committed suicide forty years ago  by throwing herself into Mt. Mihara.
ASAKAWA
Have you got anything else? RYUJI (O.S.)
Im gonna have to check it for  myself.  Ill be leaving for  Oshima tomorrow morning. ASAKAWA
Oshima?  Ive only got three days  left! RYUJI (O.S.)
I know.  And Ive got four. Short silence. RYUJI (O.S.)
Ill be in touch. Ryuji hangs up.  Asakawa, deep in thought, slowly places back in its CRADLE.  She turns around to walk back down t only to find her father standing there, face full of conc KOUJI
Whats happened? Asakawa shakes her head. ASAKAWA
Nothing.  I just had some things  left over from work. She walks past her father, who glances worriedly after he shoulder.
The lights are all off and Asakawa is asleep in her futon suddenly fly open as a VOICE sounding eerily like her dec Tomoko calls out to her. TOMOKO (O.S.)
Auntie? Asakawa looks around the room, gets her bearings.  Her ey the futon next to hers. ASAKAWA

Yoichi? There is a BODY in that futon, but it is full-grown, dres black.  It is curled into a fetal position and has its he away. Suddenly, the IMAGE from the video of the figure with its shrouded springs to Asakawas mind.  Just an instant, its visage materializes, and then disappears.  It reappears a later, pointing more insistently now, and disappears agai Asakawa blinks her eyes and realizes that the futon next empty.  Yoichi is nowhere to be seen. Just then, she hears that high-pitched, metallic SQUEAKIN video.  Eyes wide with horror, she flings the sliding doo --and there, seated before the television, is Yoichi. He is watching the video. It is already at the very last scene, the shot of the out CLOSEUP on the screen now, and for just an instant we can something is trying to claw its way out of the well.  The off, and the screen fills with static.   Shrieking, Asakawa races over to Yoichi, covers his eyes already too late.  She scoots over to the VCR, ejects the stares at it uncomprehendingly.  She is then at Yoichis s shaking him roughly. ASAKAWA
Yoichi!  You brought this with you,  didnt you?  Why?!? YOICHI
Tomo-chan... Asakawa freezes, her eyes wide. YOICHI
Tomo-chan told me to watch it.
WAVES are being kicked up by a large PASSENGER SHIP as it its way.  CUT to Asakawa and Ryuji standing on deck, look the waves. RYUJI
I shouldve been more careful.   When I was at your place that  day, I could feel something  there.  I thought it was just  because of the video...  ASAKAWA
You mean that Tomoko RYUJI
Thats not Tomoko.  Not anymore. ASAKAWA
Yoichi... he can see them too,  cant he? Ryuji nods his head, lowers it sadly. ASAKAWA
Its all my fault.  First Tomoko  died, then those three others.  It  should have stopped there, but it  didnt.  Because of me. RYUJI
I wonder... Asakawa turns to Ryuji suddenly. ASAKAWA
How did the rumors about the  video even start in the first  place? RYUJI
This kind of thing... it doesnt  start by one person telling a  story.  Its more like everyones  fear just takes on a life of its  own. ASAKAWA
Fear... RYUJI
Or maybe its not fear at all.   Maybe its what we were  secretly hoping for all along.
The ship has docked, its GANGPLANK extended.  Ryuji and A the length of the gangplank towards the shore.  A man nam HAYATSU is already waiting for them.  He holds up a white in both hands. ASAKAWA
Mr. Hayatsu? HAYATSU
Aah, welcome!  You must be tired  after your long trip.  Please,  this way. Mr. Hayatsu leads Asakawa and Ryuji to an awaiting miniva Caption-- September 18th.  Saturday.
Ryuji and Asakawa sit in the back.  Mr. Hayatsu is behind chattering away. HAYATSU

Back in the old days, the Yamamuras used to head fishing boats out in  Sashikiji, though they dont much  anymore.  You know, one of Shizukos  cousins is still alive. Hes just an  old man now.  His son and his  daughter-in-law run an old-fashioned  inn.  I went ahead and booked  reservations for yall, hope thats  alright... Asakawa gives the briefest of nods in reply, after which minivan lapses into silence.  Asakawa looks dreamily out mountain-studded landscape, then suddenly snaps to. ASAKAWA (to Ryuji)
Why did Yamamura Shizuko commit  suicide? RYUJI
She was taking a real beating  in the press, being called a  fraud and all sorts of names.   After a while she just lost it.  CUT to a scene of the minivan speeding along a country ro
RYUJI

Shizuko was getting a lot of  attention around the island after predicting the eruption of Mt.  Mihara.  Seems that for some time  shed had a rather unique ability: precognition. It was around then that she attracted the attention  of a certain scholar whom you may  have heard of; Ikuma Heihachiro.    ASAKAWA
He was driven out of the university,  wasnt he? Ryuji nods. RYUJI

This Professor Ikuma convinces  Shizuko to go to Tokyo with him,  where he uses her in a series of  demonstrations meant to prove the  existence of ESP.  At first shes  the darling of the press, but the  next thing you know theyre  knocking her down, calling her a  fraud.  Hmph.  Forty years later, the media still hasnt changed that much. Asakawa continues, ignoring Ryujis barb. ASAKAWA
Ive heard this story.  But... Im  sure I remember hearing that somebody  died at one of those demonstrations. A strange look crosses Ryujis face.  He looks away, ignor for a moment. RYUJI
After getting kicked out of  university, Ikuma just vanished,  and no ones been able to get hold  of him since.  Hes probably not  even alive anymore. ASAKAWA
But, why even try looking for him? RYUJI
Because hes supposed to have had a  child with Shizuko.  A daughter. Asakawa freezes.  In her mind, she sees a small FIGURE dr white, its face hidden by long, black HAIR.  It is the fi the video.
Mr. Hayatsu leads Asakawa and Ryuji to the entrance. HAYATSU
Hello? The INKEEPER, a middle-aged lady named KAZUE wearing a tr KIMONO, comes shuffling up.  She addresses Mr. Hayatsu. KAZUE
Thank you. She turns to Asakawa and Ryuji. KAZUE (contd)
Welcome. HAYATSU
Well, Ill be off then. He gives a little bow and is off.  Kazue, meanwhile, has two pairs of SLIPPERS, which she offers to Ryuji and Asak KAZUE
Please. Ryuji and Asakawa begin removing their shoes.
Kazue leads Ryuji and Asakawa up a shadowed, wooden STAIR KAZUE
And for your rooms, how shall we...?  RYUJI
Separate, please. KAZUE
Sir.
Kazue gives a little bow. KAZUE

This way. Kazue turns to the right.  Almost immediately after reach top of the steps, however, a strange look crosses Ryujis He heads down the opposite end of the corridor, Asakawa c behind. KAZUE (alarmed)

Sir! Ryuji flings open the SLIDING DOOR to one of the older ro hanging from one of the walls, is the oval-shaped MIRROR video, the one used by the mysterious lady to brush her l Ryuji stares at the mirror, almost wincing.  He turns aro to look at Asakawa,but continues turning, looks past her. follows his gaze, as does Kazue.  Standing at the end of is an old man, MR. YAMAMURA.  Yamamura regards them silently, balefully.  Breaking the Kazue gestures for Asakawa and Ryuji to follow. KAZUE (softly)
Please, this way. Asakawa races past the innkeeper towards the old man.  He back turned towards her. ASAKAWA
Please!  If you could just answer  a few questions, about Shizuko... YAMAMURA
I got nuthin to say. ASAKAWA
Its about Shizukos daughter. The old man says nothing. ASAKAWA
She did have a daughter, didnt she? Yamamura regards her for a moment, then turns to walk awa YAMAMURA         Youre wasting your time.

The TABLE is laid out with an elaborate-looking DINNER. sits alone, knees curled up to her chin, eyes wide and fr She is whimpering softly to herself.  Just then, the DOOR open and Ryuji walks in.  He sits at the table and picks pair of CHOPSTICKS. RYUJI
Arent you gonna eat? ASAKAWA
Umm... RYUJI
Hm? ASAKAWA
Youll stay with me wont you?   When its time for me to die. RYUJI
Oh, stop it. Asakawa scoots across the tatami mats towards the table, Ryuji fiercely by the arm. ASAKAWA
Youll stay, wont you?  If you  stayed, maybe youd learn something that could help Yoichi-- RYUJI
I said stop it!  Have you forgotten  There was a girl with Tomoko when  she died?  That girls now in a  mental institution.  Who knows what  could happen.  ASAKAWA
But you could stay with me, Ryuji.   Youd be OK. RYUJI (angrily)
Why, because Im already not  right in the head? Asakawa releases her hold on Ryujis arm, lowers her head. slams his chopsticks down angrily. RYUJI
If thats the case, why not just let things run its course, get rid of father -and- son?  Yoichi was a mistake, anyway. ASAKAWA
Stop it! Short silence.  When Ryuji speaks up again, his voice is reassuring. RYUJI
We still have two days left... Just then the VOICE of the innkeeper calls tentatively ou the other side of the sliding door. KAZUE (O.S.)
Excuse me? RYUJI
Come in. Kazue slides the door open.  She stands hesitantly in the something tucked under one arm. KAZUE
Its about Miss Shizuko.   Ryuji shoots a glance at Asakawa and stands up from the t walks towards the innkeeper. KAZUE
This is all that there is... Kazue produces an old black and white PHOTOGRAPH.  The ph WOMAN, seated, dressed in a KIMONO.  A MAN in a Western-s stands beside her.   RYUJI
Is this Professor Ikuma? Hearing this Asakawa leaps up, walks over to examine the herself. KAZUE
...yes.  This picture is from before  Id entered the household.   She pauses a moment. KAZUE (contd)
I should go now. The innkeeper scuttles off, leaving Asakawa and Ryuji alo photograph.  Unbidden, the VOICE from the video enters th thoughts. VOICE
Shoumon bakkari... boukon ga kuru zo...

Asakawa watches Ryuji stride down the shore. Caption-- September 19th.  Monday. Ryuji strolls up to find old man Yamamura sitting alone, out at the sea.  Yamamura glances up to see Ryuji approac Ryuji takes a seat next to the old man, but its Yamamura first.  The deep basso of his voice emphasizes the drawl accent. YAMAMURA
Yalld do best to be off soon.   Seas probably gonna be rough  tonight. RYUJI
What kind of a child was Shizuko? YAMAMURA

Shizuko was... different.  Shed come  out here by herself everday an just stare out at the ocean.  The fishermen  all took a dislikin to her.  Oceans  an unlucky place for us, ysee: every  year it swallows up more of our own.  You keep starin out at somethin  ike that...  RYUJI Shoumon bakkari shiteru to, boukon ga
kuru zo.  If you keep playing in the  water, the monster will come for you. Yamamura looks at Ryuji, surprised.   RYUJI

Shizuko could see inside people,  couldnt she?  Down to the places  theyd most like to keep hidden.  It  must have been difficult for her... Yamamura rises unsteadily to his feet, features twisted a YAMAMURA
Please leave!  Now! Ryuji stands, takes hold of Yamamuras arm. RYUJI
Ive got a little of that ability  myself.  It was you who spread the  word about Shizuko, wasnt it?   And you who first contacted  Professor Ikuma? YAMAMURA
Whatre you--? RYUJI
You thought youd be able to make  some money off her.  You even got  some, from one of the newspapers. YAMAMURA
Leave me the hell alone! Mr. Yamamura strides angrily off.  Both Ryuji and Asakawa pursuit, Ryuji calling out from behind Yamamuras back. RYUJI
Tell us about Shizukos daughter.   Who was she? YAMAMURA
I dont know! RYUJI

She was there, with Shizuko. She  had to be. Yamamuras pace, which has become increasingly erratic, fi causes him to stumble and fall.  Ryuji comes up behind hi grasping him firmly.  At their touch Ryujis power awakens he peers into the old mans mind there is a sudden blindin

The setting is a large MEETING HALL.  A number of people in folding chairs before a STAGE, on which are a four MEN SUITS and a WOMAN in a KIMONO.  A BANNER hangs above the reads PUBLIC DEMONSTRATION ON THE EXISTENCE OF CLAIRVOYAN
Ryuji eyes widen as he realizes he is seeing Shizukos dem before the press.  He also realizes-- RYUJI (to Yamamura)
You were there!
YAMAMURA SHIZUKO, the woman in the kimono, is sitting at onstage. Her face is calm and expressionless.  Standing o side and peering from behind the curtains is a young Mr. RYUJI        (O.S.)
You stood there and watched the  demonstration. CUT back to the beach.  Asakawa comes running up toward R prone Mr. Yamamura.  Suddenly there is another

Asakawa, her eyes wide, finds herself inside the scene, r as if she had actually been there.  She watches as Shizuk a sealed clay POT in both hands.  Shizuko regards the pot and then places it gently on the table before her.  She t calligraphy STYLUS from the table, begins writing on a th rectangular sheet of RICE PAPER.  The members of the pres excitedly, craning their necks for a better look. Onstage, a JUDGE holds up the phrase written by Shizuko a folded sheet of paper taken from the sealed pot.  The phr sheets is identical. JUDGE
Match. Cameras begin FLASHING excitedly.  Shizukos features melt smile.  The experiment is performed again, and again the phrase w Shizuko corresponds to the sealed sheet of paper. JUDGE
Match. Again and again, Shizuko unerringly demonstrates her powe the unseen.  Finally, a bearded REPORTER explodes from hi begins striding angrily towards the stage. REPORTER
Faker!  This is nothing but trickery,  and the lowest form of trickery at  that.  The reporter stops at the foot of the stage, points his f accusingly at Shizuko. REPORTER
What are you trying to pull, woman? A SECOND REPORTER sitting in the front row also rises to REPORTER #2

Thats right!  Professor Ikuma,  youre being fooled! By now most of the press has risen from their chairs, poi shouting angrily. Onstage, Shizuko backs away, eyes wide frightened.  She covers both ears, trying to block out th din.  Professor Ikuma holds her protectively by the shoul first reporter is still shouting angrily, his voice risin others.  Suddenly, a pained look crosses his face and he the floor.  The crowd, and Asakawa as well, see that the face is contorted into a grotesque mask of fear. REPORTER #3
Whats happened? REPORTER #4
Hes dead! REPORTER #5         (to Shizuko)
Witch! Professor Ikuma begins leading Shizuko offstage.  They st unseen steps up, blocking their passage.  Shizukos eyes w head shaking in disbelief. SHIZUKO
Sadako?  Was it you? CUT to Ryuji on the beach.  He looks up excitedly. RYUJI

Sadako?! He recalls the image from the video, the alien eye with t character SADA reflected in reverse. * >* The majority of girls' names in Japanese end in either >or -ko ("child").  Thus, Sadako means "Chaste child."  S >course, the mysterious daughter of Shizuko and Professor RYUJI
Sadako killed him?  She can kill  just with a thought? YAMAMURA

Shes... a devil spawn. CUT back to the demonstration hall.  Sadako, her face com by her long hair, runs offstage... and heads directly for Asakawa instinctively raises her arm, and Sadako grasps i All the nails on Sadako hand are stripped away; her finge bloody stumps. CUT back to the beach.  Asakawa, still caught in the thro vision, has begun to swoon.  Finally her legs give out an to the beach.  Ryuji grabs hold of her supportively.  He her wrist, sees an ugly, purple BRUISE already beginning The bruise is in the shape of five long, spindly fingers. Mr. Yamamura slowly rises to a sitting position, and toge watch the approach of ominous, dark STORM CLOUDS.
Asakawa is on the phone, her voice almost frantic. ASAKAWA

Thats right. After Yamamura Shizuko  committed suicide, Professor Ikuma took the daughter and ran.  No, no one knows where they went.  Thats why I  need -you- to find out where they are.   Even if the professors dead, Sadako  should still be in her forties.  Ill  explain it all later, but right now  just hurry! Asakawa slams the phone down.  PAN to show Ryuji slumped of the room, his back to the wall. RYUJI
Sadakos probably already dead.  She could kill people with just a thought,  remember?  Her mother wasnt even  close to that. ASAKAWA         (flustered)
Well, what about that video?  If  Sadakos dead then who made it? RYUJI
Nobody made it. It wasnt made at  all. That video... is the pure,  physical manifestation of Sadakos  hatred. Ryuji turns to regard Asakawa, his eyes blank. RYUJI
Weve been cursed. There is a moment of silence before Mr. Hayatsu slides th almost falling into the room.  He is out of breath, and s HAYATSU
Its no good.  With the typhoon  coming in, all ships are  temporarily staying docked. RYUJI
What about the fishing boats?   Tell their captains Ill pay. HAYATSU

Fishing boats?  Sir, without knowing  whether this typhoon is going to hit  us or not, I think itd be better to  wait and see how things turn-- Ryuji interrupts him, slamming both palms on the table. rattle wildly. RYUJI
Fine!  Ill try searching myself! Ryuji stands and races past Mr. Hayatsu out into the rain takes pursuit, calling after him. HAYATSU
Mr. Takayama!?  Mr. Takayama... Asakawa, left alone, stares down at the tatami mats.
White-capped waves roll angrily in a black sea.
Asakawa sits at a table, alone, her hands clasped as if i eyes are wide and glassy.  The phone RINGS suddenly and A for it, wrenching it from the cradle before it can ring a ASAKAWA
Hello? OKAZAKI (O.S.)
Mrs. Asakawa?  Im sorry.  I tried,  but I couldnt come up with any  leads at all. A look of abject fear crosses Asakawas face.  She begins into herself. OKAZAKI (O.S.)
Hello? ASAKAWA (softly)
Thank you... Asakawa slowly places the phone back in its cradle.  Almo her face begins to crumple.  She falls to her knees, sobb floor. ASAKAWA
Yoichi... She cries a while longer but suddenly stops.  Her face, e with tears, shoots suddenly up, stares directly at the te ASAKAWA          (softly)
Izu...
Asakawa stands looking down on the wharf, scanning.  Several FISHING BOATS are docked.  The wind whips her hai around.   She continues scanning, and suddenly she spies- ASAKAWA         (calling)
Ryuji! Asakawa runs down onto the wharf, heading towards Ryuji. in mid-conversation with Mr. Hayatsu. ASAKAWA
Ryuji!  The phone in my apartment  never rang!  It only ever rang at the rental cottage!  Professor  Ikuma mustve... RYUJI
And weve got no way of going back. HAYATSU

Its too dangerous!  The thought of  anybody going out in this weather... The three fall into silence as they realize the powerless situation.  Suddenly, a deep VOICE booms from behind them YAMAMURA (O.S.)
Ill take you out. The three spin around to see Mr. Yamamura, his ROBES flap gusty night air. He begins walking towards them. YAMAMURA
Sadako is callin yall, reckon.   Mayhap to drag you down under the  water. Short silence.  Ryuji shoots a short questioning glance a turns back to face Mr. Yamamura. RYUJI
Please.  Take us out.
A tiny FISHING BOAT is tossed about on the waves.  Mr. Ya at the wheel, his face expressionless.

head_text.subj: INT. MR. YAMAMURAS FISHING BOAT NIGHT

text: Ryuji and Asakawa are crouched close together in the cabi expression is dreamy, faraway. ASAKAWA
Its funny.  Im not afraid at all.   Ryuji leans over, rubs her hand comfortingly.  Suddenly h back into analytical mode. RYUJI
Sadako probably died back out there at Izu, before the rental cottages  were ever built. ASAKAWA
So, Sadako was Professor Ikumas  daughter? RYUJI (nodding)

Ikuma smuggled her out in secret.   His relationship with Shizuko was  already a scandal, and one of the  reasons he got drummed out of the  university... Weve gotta find  Sadakos body. ASAKAWA (excitedly)
Is that going to break the curse?   Will Yoichi be all right? RYUJI
Its all weve got left to try. ASAKAWA
Just one more day... Ryuji puts his arm around Asakawa.
Ryuji stands on deck, looking out over the water.  He hea below toward the captains area.  Mr. Yamamura is at the w RYUJI
We made it.  Maybe Sadako doesnt  have it out for us after all. Long pause as Mr. Yamamura says nothing. YAMAMURA
Shizuko... she used to -speak- to  the ocean, just ramble away.  One  time I hid, listenin to one of her  conversations. Mr. Yamamura pauses again. YAMAMURA (contd)
And it werent in no human language.

head_text.subj: EXT. MR. YAMAMURAS FISHING BOAT DAWN

text: Asakawa has climbed out on deck and is looking up towards Caption-- September 20th.  Monday.

Ryuji races out of the store, loaded down with supplies. pair of BUCKETS in one hand and a CROWBAR and SHOVEL in t length of ROPE is coiled over his left shoulder.  He runs RENTAL CAR, passing by Asakawa who stands at a PAYPHONE, hand. YOICHI (O.S.)
Hello? ASAKAWA
Yoichi?  Its mommy.  I just called  to say Ill be coming home tomorrow. Ryuji shoots a look at her over his shoulder. YOICHI (O.S.)
Im tired of it here, mom!  I wanna go back to school. ASAKAWA (smiling)
Yoichi, its rude to your grandpa  to talk like that. YOICHI (O.S.)
Hes laughing.  You wanna talk to him? ASAKAWA
No, thats... Asakawa pauses, her voice hitching.  She seems about to l her composure. ASAKAWA
Im sorry, Yoichi.  Ill... Ill  see you tomorrow.   YOICHI (O.S.)
Whats wrong? Asakawas face scrunches up in an effort to hold back tear ASAKAWA

Mommys got something she has to do.   Say hello to grandpa for me, OK? Ryuji stands by the car, scowling over at Asakawa.  He sh just short of a slam.  CUT to Asakawa hanging up the phon runs towards the rental car and enters the passenger side blankly into space.  Ryuji slides into the drivers seat,
RYUJI
What time was it when you first  watched the video? Asakawa glances at her watch. ASAKAWA
Seven or eight minutes past  seven.  PM.  No more than ten  minutes past. RYUJI
If the rumors are true, that  time is gonna be our deadline. Asakawa buckles up as Ryuji steps on the gas.
Asakawa sits in the passenger side.  Her face is almost a with the faintest hint of a smile.  Ryuji shoots a questi at her.

The white rental car tears past the SIGN reading Izu Paci The car continues into the LOT, screeching around corners coming to an abrupt halt.  Asakawa, her face still oddly gets out of the passenger side.  Ryuji exits as well, the shudder running through him as he regards the series of r RYUJI

-Here-. CUT to Asakawa and Ryuji walking up the gravel PATH towar cabins.  Ryuji looks back over his shoulder as both he an before cabin B4.  The cabin is on STILTS, its underbelly wooden LATICEWORK.  Ryuji drops most of his supplies to t keeps hold of the PICK.  He raises the pick over one shou smashing away at the latticework.  When he has cleared en passage, he begins picking up supplies and tossing them h When finished, he holds a hand out for Asakawa.  The two earthen basement.

Ryuji pulls a FLASHLIGHT out, flicks it on.  The BEAM arc illuminating what looks more like an old mine shaft than rental cottage.  The beam halts when it suddenly encounte STONE WELL.  The well is badly chipped on one side, and s with a solid-looking stone LID.  Ryuji rushes quickly tow RYUJI
I knew it!  The well. He squats down beside the well, setting the flashlight on lid.  Asakawa sinks slowly down beside him. ASAKAWA

The well... Ryuji reaches out and takes Asakawas hand.  He sets their hands onto the lid, and together they begin lightly traci surface of the lid with their free hands.  Asakawa closes concentration... and suddenly, as with the incident on th Asakawa finds herself drawn into Ryujis psychometric VISI
The picture is black and white, grainy like old film.  A a WHITE GOWN walks slowly towards an open well. She place the LIP of the well, peers curiously down.
Asakawa looks up, her eyes wide open.

There is now a second person in the vision, an ELDERLY MA fashioned tweed SUIT standing behind the young girl.  He produces some BLADED OBJECT, and strikes the girl savagel back of the head.   The girl falls forward. The man drops to the ground, grab behind the knees and hoisting her limp BODY over the lip well.  The body falls into its depths. Panting heavily, the man leans forward and grasps the lip with both hands, looking down.  He flashes a guilty look direction, checking that his crime has gone unnoticed, an so Asakawa realizes that she knows this face.  The image videotape, like a face in the moon: it had been Sadako in looking up to see this man staring back down at her. This man whose name is Professor Ikuma Heihachiro.
ASAKAWA
Her own father! The energy seems to drain out of Asakawa in a rush, and h crumbles.  Ryuji catches hold of her. RYUJI

It was Ikuma who put this lid on.   And Sadakos still inside. Ryuji stands quickly, takes hold of the crowbar.  He inse the lid and begins trying to pry it off, face scrunched w Asakawa digs her fingers in and lends her own strength as the lid begins to move.  Ryuji tosses the crowbar aside a lean the combined weight of their bodies into it.  The li dropping to the earth with a dull THUD.  Ryuji sits to on with effort, as Asakawa takes hold of the flashlight.  Sh down into the well, but it only seems to intensify the gl WATER she can see looks fetid and brackish.  Ryuji sees h and begins removing his JACKET. RYUJI

Ill go. He walks off, leaving Asakawa alone. CUT to an overhead shot of the well.  A ROPE is fastened and Ryuji has already begun lowering himself down.  His e overthe grime-smeared WALLS, and with a shudder he begins human FINGERNAILS.  Torn loose and spattered with blood, fingernails line the sides of the well.  RYUJI

Sadako was alive!  Shed tried to  climb her way out. Ryujis face twists into a grimace as if momentarily exper Sadakosterrible agony.  He waits a moment longer before e way down the rope again, finally SPLASHING to rest at the the well.  He holds his flashlight above the brackish wat to Asakawa. RYUJI
Lower the buckets! Asakawa nods and lowers two plastic BUCKETS fastened to a grabs one and scoops up a bucketful of water, tugging on finished. RYUJI

Take it up! Asakawa hoists the bucket up to the rim of the well.  She distance and tosses the contents out onto the ground.  Sh glance through the wooden lattice to the outside, and wit realizes that the sun has already started to set.  A nerv her WATCH later and she is back at the well, lowering the to find another full one already awaiting her. RYUJI

Take it up! In the well, Ryuji glances at his watch.  He looks at it moment, the expression on his face saying Were not going Time passes as Asakawa pulls up bucketload after bucketlo strength beginning to fade.  She half-stumbles, glances u shocked to realize that NIGHT has fallen. CUT to Asakawa slowly pulling up yet another bucket, her almost gone.  She looks at her watch and sees that it is 6:00.  She calls frantically down to Ryuji. ASAKAWA
Its already six! RYUJI (explosively)

I know!  Hurry up and TAKE IT UP!! The bucket slowly jerks into motion.  Asakawa pulls it up of the well, holds it unsteadily.  She takes one falterin falls, spilling the buckets contents onto the ground.   CUT to Ryuji in the well, standing ready with another buc RYUJI
Take it up! Nothing happens.   RYUJI

Asakawa! The bucket begins moving, even slower than before.  CUT t her body trembling with effort. By now its all she can do keep her body moving.  She glances behind her, sees throu lattice that it is now pitch black.  A look of resignatio face and she releases her hold on the bucket, her body cr falling in on itself.  CUT to the bucket splashing back into the well, narrowly Ryuji. RYUJI         (fuming)
What the hell are you doing?  Trying  to get me killed? CUT back to Asakawa, her face dead.  Ryuji calls out from RYUJI (O.S.)
Hey! Asakawa falls backward onto the ground, arms splayed. CUT of the well.  Ryuji pulls himself up over the rim, catche Asakawa. RYUJI
Asakawa! She lifts her head up but says nothing as Ryuji walks ove RYUJI
Well change.  Youre in no condition  to keep this up. Asakawa suddenly springs into life.  Her voice is frantic ASAKAWA:
No! RYUJI
Who do you expect to pull up these  buckets, then? ASAKAWA
But, we dont even know if its doing  any good... Ryuji strides forward and slaps Asakawa painfully across He begins shaking her roughly for good measure. RYUJI

And what about Yoichi, huh?  Is his mother not coming to pick him up  after all? He releases his hold on her.  The two stare at each other saying nothing. CUT to an overhead shot of Asakawa being lowered into the now to Asakawa inside the well, her face and clothes cove grime, body simultaneously limp with exhaustion and tense Unable to resist the impulse, Asakawa slowly looks over h and down into the well.  The dankness, the claustrophobia and she draws in her breath in the first signs of panic. RYUJI

Dont look down! She returns her gaze, cranes her neck upward.  CUT to Ryu over the rim of the well, peering down at her.  For an in everything becomes monochrome. Its not Ryuji looking down all; its Professor Ikuma, checking to see if shes still a if the blow to the back of her head has finished her off. Asakawa, her eyes wide with fright. Asakawa comes to rest at the bottom of the well.  A FLASH from another rope, but its beam has almost no effect on t Asakawa crouches forward, hands moving searchingly throug She calls out pleadingly. ASAKAWA

Where are you?  Please, come out. Asakawa straightens, unties herself from the rope.  A ful already awaits.  She tugs on the rope and Ryuji pulls it She scoops up a second bucket, but something stops her fr it up.  Instead, she begins running her arms through the her voice close to tears. ASAKAWA

Please.  Where are you? Asakawa continues her blind fumbling, which sends up litt of stagnant water.  With a start, she realizes that her f caught something.  Seaweed?  Asakawa draws her hands clos better look... and sees that is HAIR.  A thick clump of l hair. Suddenly a pale, thin ARM shoots out from beneath the wat Asakawa just below the wrist.  Asakawas ears are filled w like moaning as something slowly rises from its watery sl is a GIRL, her face completely hidden by long, black hair shot of Asakawas face.  Far from being frightened, her fe oddly placid.  She regards the fearsome thing before her almost tender look.  Asakawa reaches out, lightly strokes hair.   ASAKAWA

Its you... She strokes the hair again, and abruptly it peels right o with a loud SQUELCH. Revealed is not a face at all but a sockets are at first menacingly empty, but then begin to green SLUDGE it has pulled up from the bottom of the well mother comforting a frightened child, Asakawa pulls the s remains to her breast, strokes the bony head comfortingly begin to glaze. CUT to Ryuji racing up to the rim of the well, leaning do RYUJI
Hey!  Asakawa!  Its already 10  minutes past seven!  We did it! Down in the well, Asakawa continues staring blankly ahead suddenly falls forward, limp.

Three POLICE CARS are parked outside the rental cottages, headlights flashing.   A few COPS walk by, two of them ca something off in white PLASTIC BAGS.  CUT to Ryuji and As sitting on the curb.  Asakawa is staring off at something draped over her shoulder.   ASAKAWA
Why would Ikuma have killed her?   His own daughter... RYUJI
Maybe she wasnt his daughter at all.   ASAKAWA
What? RYUJI

Maybe her father... wasnt even human. The two exchange glances.  Ryujis gaze falls to Asakawas which he suddenly takes and holds close to his face.  The bruise where Sadako had grabbed her has disappeared. RYUJI
Its gone...   He shakes his head, clearing his analytical mind of their RYUJI
Enough, already.  Its over.  Cmon.   Ill take you home. Ryuji stands, pulls Asakawa to her feet.
Ryujis white CAR pulls up into the parking lot.  He and A get out, regard each other from opposite sides of the car a long moment where neither of them says anything. RYUJI
Get some rest.   He flashes her the slightest of grins.  RYUJI (contd)
I still have a thesis to finish.  CUT to a shot of Ryuji and Asakawa, the car creating an a metaphoric distance between them.  ASAKAWA
...thank you. Ryuji nods silently by way of reply.  He gets into his ca drives off.  Asakawa watches him go, and then walks towar entrance of her apartment.
Asakawa walks into her room, sits on the edge of her bed. now morning, and she sits dazedly watching the sun come u

Ryuji sits busily scribbling into a NOTEBOOK.  He stops w moment to regard his notes while taking a sip of COFFEE. glances over at his BLACKBOARD for confirmation when a sm crosses his brow.  Its gone a moment later as he chuckles to himself. RYUJI
That girl... Ryuji stands, walks over to the blackboard.  He fixes Mai prank with a single chalk stroke.

Asakawa emerges, taking in the dawn.  At first her face i tranquil... but her features change as the sun almost not darkens and a WIND begins to kick up her hair.  She now l anxious. Caption-- September 21st.  Tuesday. NOTE: This next scene is entirely visual.  If you are rea translation before watching the movie, do yourself a favo reading this now and watch the scene for itself.

Ryuji is busy scribbling away at his notes again.  His ha ceases, eyes dancing worriedly as he hears a faint... No. Breath rattling fearfully in his throat, Ryuji spins arou the TELEVISION SET.  He gets out of his seat for a better falling to his knees on the tatami.  The image that fills the screen is the last scene from th the shot of the well.   The SOUND from before comes louder now, more insistent, a screeching that both repulses and beckons him closer. Ryu all fours towards the SCREEN, stares at its unchanging im terrible foreboding. There is a flash of MOTION as something shoots out of the hand. First one, and then another, as Sadako, still in he dress, face hidden beneath long, oily strands of hair, be pulling herself out.  The television screen jumps unstead with static as if barely able to contain her image.   CUT back and forth between Ryuji, who is beginning to vis and the television, which shows Sadako lurching ever clos RYUJI (almost frantic)
Why?! The TELEPHONE rings, and Ryuji spins round towards it, br in his throat.  He looks at the phone, over his shoulder television, back to the phone. RYUJI

Thats it!  Asakawa... Ryuji scrambles wildly towards the phone.  He takes the r is unable to do more than clutch it fearfully as his gaze inexorably back to the television.  Sadakos shrouded face the entire screen... and then, television popping and cra jerks forward and emerges from the television onto the fl Ryujis apartment.  Ryuji backs away, screaming in terror. RYUJI

Aaargh! Sadako lies prone, collapsed, hair splayed out like a dro Only her FINGERS are active, crawling, feeling.  The TIPS fingers are little more than bloodied stumps, not a singl on them.  She uses the strength in those fingers to pull forward, coming jerkily to her feet.  The joints of her b unnaturally, more insect-like than human. Ryuji flings the phone aside and begins scrambling about as if looking for cover.  The strength has already begun his body, however, and his movements are clumsy, exaggera to the floor, panting heavily.   Sadako turns to regard him, and for just an instant we ca her impenetrable shroud of hair; a single EYE burns with unbridled hatred.    Its gaze meets Ryujis, and his face twists into a grimace SCREAMS loudly.
Yoichi sits on the lawn, doodling into a large SKETCHPAD. suddenly stops, eyes registering that he has somehow felt death.
Asakawa clutches the RECEIVER to her ear.  She can still sounds of metallic SCREECHING coming from the video, thou now becoming softer.

head_text.subj: EXT. OUTSIDE RYUJIS APARTMENT BUILDING DAY

text: Asakawa comes running down a side street, turning the cor making for the entrance to Ryujis apartment building.  Th single GUARD posted at the entrance. He reaches out, catc lightly by the arm. GUARD
Are you a resident here, maam? ASAKAWA
Im Takayama Ryujis wife! The guard drops his hand, and Asakawa makes for the entra GUARD
Im sorry maam, but theyve already  taken the body away. Asakawas spins around, eyes wide.  Body?

head_text.subj: INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE RYUJIS APARTMENT DAY

text: Mai is there, slumped against one wall. Asakawa comes run dropping to her knees and grasping Mai by the shoulders. ASAKAWA
What happened? Mai shakes her head dreamily. MAI
When I got here he was just  lying there... ASAKAWA
Did he say anything to you?  About  a videotape? Mai shakes her head again, shakes it harder until the bre catches in her throat. MAI
His face... Mai falls into silence, curls up on herself.  Asakawa lea and crosses toward the door to Ryujis apartment.
The front DOOR opens wildly, noisily forward.  Asakawa co rushing in, eyes darting about the apartment.  She thinks frantically to herself. ASAKAWA (VO)

Ryuji... why?  Does this mean that Yoichi will die, too?  Is the curse  not broken yet? Her gaze falls to the television set.  She dives forward, the eject button on the VCR.  Sure enough, the TAPE is st the deck.  She takes the tape and leaves.

Asakawa walks slowly, dreamily forward.  She drops the vi loudly onto the coffee table and slouches into a CHAIR. fall to the framed photographs of Yoichi on one of the sh This snaps Asakawa out of her daze and she begins whisper intently to herself, thinking. ASAKAWA

I was the only one to break  Sadakos curse.  Ryuji... why...?   Something I did that you didnt...   Something I did that you didnt...   Asakawa gives up, lowers her face into her hands.  When s up again, she happens to glance at the television screen- its GLARE reveals that there is someone ELSE in the room It is the figure from the videotape, the silent accuser w cloth draped over its face.  With a start, Asakawa realiz the figure is wearing Ryujis clothes. ASAKAWA

Ryuji?! She spins around, but the room is empty.  Asakawas mind r The figure had been pointing towards her BAG.  She stands rummages in her bag to produce her copy of the cursed vid She takes Ryujis COPY in her other hand, her eyes darting between the two tapes. ASAKAWA
Something I did that you didnt... It suddenly clicks home as Asakawa looks full-on at Ryuji version of the tape, plainly marked COPY. ASAKAWA
What broke the curse was that I copied  the tape and showed it to someone else! CUT to Asakawa slowly pulling her VCR from the television A look of almost frightening resolve etches her face.
